snippet.title: Gender and Student Reception of a Seminary's Dominant Messages
snippet.description:
* Gender and Student Reception of a Seminary's Dominant Messages
Timothy D. Lincoln
Theological schools seek to educate both women and men to serve the church and promote the study of religion. This education involves constant messaging through multiple channels. This article explores the central messages received by theological students at one free-standing Presbyterian seminary in the United States. Women commonly reported two messages, a message about community (relationships between students) and ...
Journal: Christian Higher Education , vol. 11, no. 3, pp. 205-218, 2012

snippet.title: Working with Generation-D: adopting and adapting to cultural learning and change
snippet.description:
* Working with Generation-D: adopting and adapting to cultural learning and change (Citations: 6)
Win Shih, Martha Allen
Purpose – The paper aims to discuss the expectations and needs of Generation Y students for higher education specifically targeting issues relating to libraries and library management. Design/methodology/approach – The paper provides a brief overview of Generation Y personality traits and characteristics. This is followed by a discussion of organizational culture, explaining how to effectively adapt to meet the expectations ...
Journal: Library Management , vol. 28, no. 1/2, pp. 89-100, 2007
